text: The 2019 South Carolina State Bulldogs football team represented South Carolina State University in the 2019 NCAA Division I FCS football season. They were led by 18th-year head coach Oliver Pough who became the program’s all-time winningest coach during the season, surpassing former Head Coach Willie Jeffries.https://thetandd.com/news/local/buddy-and-his-bulldogs-s-c- state-celebrates-coaching- milestone/collection_842b5150-1831-5ec3-8d85-92bdeb555c11.html The Bulldogs played their home games at Oliver C. Dawson Stadium. They are a member of the Mid-Eastern Athletic Conference (MEAC). S.C. State was awarded the MEAC Co- Championship together with the North Carolina A&T; Aggies.https://thetandd.com/sports/bulldogzone/football/s-c-state-football- bulldogs-win-in-ot-claim- share/article_c2ad2784-a548-5a2f-9913-99645f3f16c8.html Both teams finished with 8–3 overall records and 6-2 within the MEAC, however due to Florida A&M; being ineligible for postseason play, and by virtue of North Carolina A&T;’s victory over South Carolina State, the Aggies received the MEAC’s bid to the Celebration Bowl. As a “bubble team” in consideration for the 2019 FCS Playoffs S.C. State was not chosen, thus ending their season.https://www.postandcourier.com/sports/furman-is-in-s-c-state-is-out- and-wofford/article_e1e2e9da-0eea-11ea-a2cc-4ffdb6ce493e.html ==Previous season== The Bulldogs finished the 2018 season 5–6, 4–3 in MEAC play to finish in a tie for fourth place. ==Preseason== ===MEAC poll=== In the MEAC preseason poll released on July 26, 2019, the Bulldogs were predicted to finish in sixth place. {| class="wikitable" |- align="center" |- align="center" | 1 || North Carolina A&T; || 304 (12) |- align="center" | 2 || Bethune–Cookman || 237 (1) |- align="center" | 3 || Florida A&M; || 204 (2) |- align="center" | 4 || Howard || 166 |- align="center" | 5 || North Carolina Central || 161 (1) |- align="center" | 6 || South Carolina State || 152 |- align="center" | 7 || Norfolk State || 119 (1) |- align="center" | 8 || Morgan State || 87 (1) |- align="center" | 9 || Delaware State || 46 |} ===Preseason All–MEAC teams=== The Bulldogs had two players selected to the preseason all-MEAC teams. First Team Offense Alex Taylor – OL Second Team Offense Mike Terry – C Third Team Offense Tyrece Nick – QB Second Team Defense Tyrell Goodwin – DL Paul Mckeiver – DL Third Team Defense Bruce Johnson – DL Decobe Durant – DB ==Schedule== ==Game summaries== ===No. 9 Wofford=== {| class="wikitable" |- align="center" |- align="center" | 2–6 | 2006 | L, 21–28 |} ===Lane=== {| class="wikitable" |- align="center" |- align="center" | 3–3 | 1963 | W, 81–0 |} ===at South Florida=== {| class="wikitable" |- align="center" |- align="center" |colspan=3|First meeting |} ===at Delaware State=== {| class="wikitable" |- align="center" |- align="center" | 28–17 | 2018 | W, 30–19 |} ===Florida A&M;=== {| class="wikitable" |- align="center" |- align="center" | 26–30–2 | 2018 | W, 44–21 |} ===Morgan State=== {| class="wikitable" |- align="center" |- align="center" | 33–6–1 | 2018 | W, 21–18 |} ===at Bethune–Cookman=== {| class="wikitable" |- align="center" |- align="center" | 33–24–1 | 2018 | L, 26–28 |} ===North Carolina A&T;=== {| class="wikitable" |- align="center" |- align="center" | 31–22–2 | 2018 | L, 16–31 |} ===Howard=== {| class="wikitable" |- align="center" |- align="center" | 34–11 | 2018 | W, 27–21 |} ===at North Carolina Central=== {| class="wikitable" |- align="center" |- align="center" | 13–12 | 2018 | L, 17–21 |} ===at Norfolk State=== {| class="wikitable" |- align="center" |- align="center" | 18–5 | 2018 | L, 7–17 |} ==References== South Carolina State Category:South Carolina State Bulldogs football seasons Category:Mid-Eastern Athletic Conference football champion seasons South Carolina State Bulldogs football
